content.description: This route ascend a small bulge/roof then follows a thin crack and small edges to the chains
content.protection: Gear to 0.5" many wires needed. Offset wires are useful.

content.description:
Spy the thin double crack system that goes over a bulge on white rock above. This is what you aim for and is essentially the second half of the climb.

The first half is largely a crack system that ranges from hands to fingers. A bit mungy still. Where it pinches down, you brave the face up and left using some knobs and flakes until reaching the first bolt (~60' up).

From here, there's a wide crack (where a 4" or 5" piece is handy) and the beginnings of the double crack system. Delicate stemming, high steps, and lie-backs will see you up past the next and final bolt and to the anchors.

SAFETY NOTE: You can just barely top rope with a 70m, so use caution and knot the ends.
content.protection: Gear from fingers to 3" with one 4-5" piece. Two bolts en route. Chain anchors.
content.location: Between Dr. Sleep and Ativan Grin. There is a tree growing halfway up that is a bit left of the route and is in the path of the lower off/rappel.

content.description: Climb the slab arete to the right of Numb Bunion
Climb a series of slightly right leaning cracks to the chains located underneath a roof.
content.location: Located to the right of Ativan's Grin.

content.description:
This long route ascend the a mellow crack to a tree.  At the tree the route steepens and the crack thins and flares a bit.  Clip the bolt then face climb left and up underneath a roof that becomes a corner to the top.

With a 70m rope, when lowering you

barely

make it so tie a knot in the end of the rope!
content.location: Start right of Groove Tube in a large, blocky alcove.

content.description: climb the bolted arÃªte 20feet left of cartwheel
content.protection: 4 bolts medium stoppers and a purple Camelot.
content.location: after crossing stream to approach 3rd tier about 30 feet up trail on left before cartwheel and numbunion

content.description: This is the thin finger crack that starts to the right of Ativan Grin and finishes at chains just below the obvious roof.
content.protection: doubles in micro through finger sized cams and nuts.
content.location: Right of Attivan Grin (see topo on main woodfords page)

climbs.name: The Choad
climbs.fa: FA: Kennedy & Bauer FFA: Christman & Waldron

content.protection: Pro to 3" optional 4" doubles in the .75 to 3 range will be comfy.
content.location: This is the very first route as you cross the creek on the approach to the 3rd tier.  Start below a small roof that is ~12ft up.

content.description:
Climb up to a horizontal crack, continue up the crack that goes straight through an obvious roof then jogs left and up a steep wall to a slab.  The chains are set back 10 feet on the slab.

Note- the original route required one to "cartwheel" across a blank section to the base of the slab, however Mark Bauer did a more direct and exciting variation to the chains.
content.protection: Pro to 1.5", wires and micros useful.  For the last 20 feet the pro is questionable.
content.location: Located up and right of The Dark Half

content.description: This finger crack climbs the broken face and short finger crack to a ledge just above the middle of the third tier ledge.  Then the main crack leads you to the chains (and through a bush) another 80' higher.  Gear can be finicky, but its all there.
content.protection: doubles of nuts to finger sized cams and singles to 2". Micro cams are helpful
content.location: See topo on main Woodfords Page for location of route.
